entries.content:
Session started with Moti. Refreshed memory on Sementix project:

KEY RECENT ACHIEVEMENTS:
- Ultra-modular CSS refactoring for tool permission dialog (Oct 17)
- Complete multi-state architecture for permission system
- Rich metadata permission dialogs with full ToolInfo context
- User conversation history with event-driven architecture (Oct 17)
- Codex SDK integration with 3-tier fallback system (Oct 13)
- Streaming infrastructure implementation with real-time parsing
- Migration UI with real-time progress tracking
- File watcher and job management systems

ARCHITECTURE HIGHLIGHTS:
- Extension uses multi-state architecture (active/permission_needed/agent_busy)
- Event-driven communication between extension and UI via iframe
- Glassmorphism design system with designer controls
- Ultra-modular patterns: orchestrator + focused micro-components
- Permission system with structured detection (no brittle keyword matching)

CURRENT GIT STATUS:
- Modified: test-sementix-memory.ts, MCPServerManager.ts, HttpMemoryService.ts, MemoryService.ts
- New files: CreateDeltaMemoryHandler.ts, CreateDeltaMemorySchema.ts
- Looks like we're working on MCP server memory features

Moti is testing new create_delta_memory MCP tool:
- CreateDeltaMemorySchema.ts: Defines tool with full schema (task, agent, date, component, summary, temporal_context, tags, content)
- CreateDeltaMemoryHandler.ts: Validates and creates memory via MemoryService
- HttpMemoryService.ts: Has createDeltaMemory() method that POSTs to /memory/ endpoint

This allows MCP clients to write delta memories directly through the protocol!
Found test script at scripts/tests/mcp-client/test-sementix-memory.ts that already includes create_delta_memory test case (lines 136-182). Going to run it to verify the tool works.
